revised_title: Cubic Phases of Self-Assembled Amphiphilic Aggregates in Liquid Crystals
tldr: This article discusses the various types of cubic liquid-crystalline mesophases formed by amphiphiles, focusing on their unique structures and properties. It explores the forces acting between bilayers and the role of interfacial curvature in these complex packings. The article also highlights the importance of understanding these self-assembled structures in biological systems, such as cell membranes and organelles.
